statements.name: PROC HPFESMSPEC
statements.description: The HPFESMSPEC procedure creates model specifications files for exponential smoothing models (ESM). † You can specify many types of exponential models with this procedure. In particular, any model that can be analyzed using the HPF procedure can be specified.
statements.help:
PROC HPFESMSPEC <LABEL="specification label"> <NAME=SAS-name> <REPOSITORY=SAS-catalog-name | SAS-file-reference>;     
	ESM <CRITERION=<SSE | MSE | RMSE>... > <DAMPPARM=number> <DAMPREST=(number, number )> ...;

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a descriptive label for the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Names the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference. The NAME= option can also be specified as SPECNAME=.

arguments.name: REPOSITORY=
arguments.description: Names the SAS catalog or external file reference to contain the model specification. The REPOSITORY= option can also be specified as MODELREPOSITORY=, MODELREP=, or REP=.

statements.name: ESM
statements.description: The ESM statement is used to specify an exponential smoothing model.

arguments.name: CRITERION=
arguments.description: Specifies the model selection criterion (statistic of fit) to be used to select from several candidate models.
arguments.help: CRITERION=SSE | MSE | RMSE | UMSE | URMSE | MAXPE | MINPE | MPE | MAPE | MDAPE | GMAPE | MAPES | MDAPES | GMAPES | MINPPE | MAXPPE | MPPE | MAPPE | MDAPPE | GMAPPE | MINSPE | MAXSPE | MSPE | SMAPE | MDASPE | GMASPE | MINRE | MAXRE | MRE | MRAE | MDRAE | GMRAE | MAXERR | MINERR | ME | MAE | MASE | RSQUARE | ADJRSQ | AADJRSQ | RWRSQ | AIC | AICC | SBC | APC*option*

arguments.name: MAPES
arguments.description: Mean absolute error percent of standard deviation

arguments.name: MDAPES
arguments.description: Median absolute error percent of standard deviation

arguments.name: GMAPES
arguments.description: Geometric mean absolute error percent of standard deviation

arguments.name: MAPPE
arguments.description: Symmetric mean absolute predictive percent error

arguments.name: GMAPPE
arguments.description: Geometric mean absolute predictive percent error

arguments.name: GMASPE
arguments.description: Geometric mean absolute symmetric percent error

arguments.name: DAMPPARM=
arguments.description: Specifies the damping weight parameter initial value.

arguments.name: DAMPREST=
arguments.description: Specifies the damping weight parameter restrictions.

arguments.name: LEVELPARM=
arguments.description: Specifies the level weight parameter initial value.

arguments.name: LEVELREST=
arguments.description: Specifies the level weight parameter restrictions.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the median forecast values be estimated. Forecasts can be based on the mean or median.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the forecasting model to be used to forecast the time series.
arguments.help: METHOD=SIMPLE | DOUBLE | LINEAR | DAMPTREND | ADDSEASONAL | MULTSEASONAL | SEASONAL | WINTERS | ADDWINTERS | BEST | BESTN | BESTS*method-name*

arguments.name: BEST
arguments.description: Best candidate smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND), (ADDSEASONAL, ADDWINTERS, WINTERS)

arguments.name: BESTN
arguments.description: Best candidate nonseasonal smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND)

arguments.name: BESTS
arguments.description: Best candidate seasonal smoothing model (ADDSEASONAL, ADDWINTERS, WINTERS)

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Specifies that the smoothing model parameters are fixed values.

arguments.name: NOSTABLE
arguments.description: Specifies that the smoothing model parameters are not restricted to the additive invertible region of the parameter space.

arguments.name: SEASONPARM=
arguments.description: Specifies the season weight parameter initial value.

arguments.name: SEASONREST=
arguments.description: Specifies the season weight parameter restrictions.

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: Specifies the time series transformation to be applied to the time series.
arguments.help: TRANSFORM=NONE | LOG | SQRT | LOGISTIC | BOXCOX | AUTO*option*

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No transformation. This option is the default.

arguments.name: BOXCOX
arguments.description: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: Automatically choose between NONE and LOG based on model selection criteria.

arguments.name: TRENDPARM=
arguments.description: Specifies the trend weight parameter initial value.

arguments.name: TRENDREST=
arguments.description: Specifies the trend weight parameter restrictions.
